event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The number of correctable errors detected within a MAC chip has exceeded an acceptable threshold.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The number of correctable errors detected within a MAC chip has exceeded an acceptable threshold.


  SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:
     
      There is no MAC chip on a M3000 platform. 
      The JSC chip provides the same functionality as the MAC chip and is located on the MBU.

      Platform becomes unbootable.



   SPARC Enterprise M4000/M5000 platforms:
     
      The MAC Chip is located on the Memory board.

      8 DIMMs associated with the MAC chip will be deconfigured
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots
      or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.

 

   SPARC Enterprise M8000/M9000 platforms:
     
      The MAC Chip is located on the CMU.

      16 DIMMs associated with the MAC chip will be deconfigured
      after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots
      or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.



The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:19:11 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: c542acf5-c3cd-4c22-bf7a-de0c6dc9ef18
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8002-Y5 for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8002-Y5, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:19:11 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: c542acf5-c3cd-4c22-bf7a-de0c6dc9ef18
   DESC: The number of correctable errors detected within a MAC chip has exceeded an
   acceptable threshold.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8002-Y5 for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: Memory associated to the MAC will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after
   the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
   IMPACT: No immediate impact. Memory associated to the MAC will be deconfigured after the platform is power
   cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command

   
   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u c542acf5-c3cd-4c22-bf7a-de0c6dc9ef18

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:19:11.9034 c542acf5-c3cd-4c22-bf7a-de0c6dc9ef18 SCF-8002-Y5
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.mac.ce

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/mac=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/mac=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                             part=CA20393-B54X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B/MEMB#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: No immediate impact. Memory associated to the MAC will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: Memory associated to the MAC will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Correctable errors detected within a MAC chip have exceeded an acceptable threshold.
